holidays.name: International Students' Day
holidays.description: A day to honor student activism and commemorate their role in fighting for freedom and justice worldwide.
holidays.origin: Originated in 1941 to remember the 1939 Nazi storming of Czech universities and the execution and imprisonment of student leaders.
holidays.funFact: In some countries, November 17 is marked by marches and demonstrations advocating for educational rights and social justice.

holidays.name: Take a Hike Day
holidays.description: Encourages people to get outdoors and enjoy nature by going for a hike, no matter their skill level or location.
holidays.origin: Unofficial observance created to promote physical activity and mental well-being through hiking.
holidays.funFact: Even if you live in an urban area, you can celebrate by exploring local parks or urban trails on Take a Hike Day!

holidays.name: Homemade Bread Day
holidays.description: A delicious day dedicated to baking your own bread from scratch and enjoying the warm, fresh-from-the-oven goodness.
holidays.origin: Unofficial food holiday started by baking enthusiasts, celebrating the timeless art of bread-making.
holidays.funFact: The scent of baking bread can boost happiness and reduce stress ‚Äì making Homemade Bread Day a day for both taste and mood!

holidays.name: National Eat a Cranberry Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the tart, vibrant cranberry by incorporating it into your meals or snacks today.
holidays.origin: Primarily recognized in the US due to cranberries' harvest season and Thanksgiving traditions.
holidays.funFact: Cranberries are one of the only fruits native to North America and were used by Native Americans for food and medicinal purposes.
